snippet: An art dealer was arrested as part of a scheme to sell dozens of forged masterpieces by artists like Rothko, Pollock and de Kooning, the authorities say.
abstract: Long Island art dealer Glafira Rosales is arrested in connection with scheme to sell dozens of forged masterpieces by artists like Rothko, Pollock and de Kooning; federal agents say Rosales sold 40 counterfeit works through Knoedler & Company, venerable Upper East Side gallery that took in about $63 million from their sale; gallery has since closed.

byline.original: By PATRICIA COHEN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: An art dealer was arrested as part of a scheme to sell dozens of forged masterpieces by artists like Rothko, Pollock and de Kooning, the authorities say.

headline.main: One Queens Painter Created Forgeries That Sold for Millions, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: One Queens Painter Created Forgeries That Sold for Millions, U.S. Says
